channel.title: How to make new food BEGINNER FRIENDLY
channel.description:
Hey guys, this tutorial is NOT leeched (I'm sorry for leeching 2other tutorials :( )
Ok first of all go to Food.java (source/src/server/model/players)
On the top of your Food.java you'll see: [code] public static enum FoodToEat { MANTA(391,22,"Manta Ray"), SHARK(385,20,"Shark"), LOBSTER(379,12,"Lobster"), TROUT(333,7,"Trout"), SALMON(329,9,"Salmon"), SWORDFISH(373,14,"Swordfish"), TUNA(361,10,"Tuna"), MONKFISH(7946,16,"Monkfish"), SEA_TURTLE(397,22,"Sea Turtle"), TUNA_POTATO(7060,22,"Tuna Potato");[/code]
[b][u]EXPLAINED:[/u][/b] I'll take for example: [code]MANTA(391,22,"Manta Ray"),[/code] '391' is the ID of the item (Manta Ray). '22' If you eat it it heals 22. 'Manta Ray' is the description (Doesn"t matter, just to make it easy.)
Ok now the real work, we're going to add new food!! 1)Search the ID of the item you want to use. (The ID i'm going to use is '2309' <-- a bread) 2)write a new line with your food. (Follow the explanation above) 3)Compile and run.
This is how my code looks like: [code] public static enum FoodToEat { MANTA(391,22,"Manta Ray"), SHARK(385,20,"Shark"), LOBSTER(379,12,"Lobster"), TROUT(333,7,"Trout"), SALMON(329,9,"Salmon"), SWORDFISH(373,14,"Swordfish"), TUNA(361,10,"Tuna"), MONKFISH(7946,16,"Monkfish"), SEA_TURTLE(397,22,"Sea Turtle"), TUNA_POTATO(7060,22,"Tuna Potato"), [code]BREAD(2309,3,"Bread");[/code]
I'll explain my code: [code]BREAD(2309,3,"Bread");[/code] '2309 is the ID of a bread.) '3' is the amount it heals. 'Bread' is the description to make it easy.
I hope this helped you and please leave a comment!

item.title: How to make new food BEGINNER FRIENDLY
item.dc:creator: @dwarfs222 dwarfs222
item.description:
@dwarfs222 wrote:

Hey guys,
this tutorial is NOT leeched (I’m sorry for leeching 2other tutorials )

Ok first of all go to Food.java (source/src/server/model/players)

On the top of your Food.java you’ll see:

public static enum FoodToEat { MANTA(391,22,"Manta Ray"), SHARK(385,20,"Shark"), LOBSTER(379,12,"Lobster"), TROUT(333,7,"Trout"), SALMON(329,9,"Salmon"), SWORDFISH(373,14,"Swordfish"), TUNA(361,10,"Tuna"), MONKFISH(7946,16,"Monkfish"), SEA_TURTLE(397,22,"Sea Turtle"), TUNA_POTATO(7060,22,"Tuna Potato");

EXPLAINED:
I’ll take for example:

‘391’ is the ID of the item (Manta Ray).
‘22’ If you eat it it heals 22.
‘Manta Ray’ is the description (Doesn"t matter, just to make it easy.)

Ok now the real work, we’re going to add new food!!
1)Search the ID of the item you want to use. (The ID i’m going to use is ‘2309’ <-- a bread)
2)write a new line with your food. (Follow the explanation above)
3)Compile and run.

This is how my code looks like:

public static enum FoodToEat { MANTA(391,22,"Manta Ray"), SHARK(385,20,"Shark"), LOBSTER(379,12,"Lobster"), TROUT(333,7,"Trout"), SALMON(329,9,"Salmon"), SWORDFISH(373,14,"Swordfish"), TUNA(361,10,"Tuna"), MONKFISH(7946,16,"Monkfish"), SEA_TURTLE(397,22,"Sea Turtle"), TUNA_POTATO(7060,22,"Tuna Potato"), [code]BREAD(2309,3,"Bread");

I’ll explain my code:

'2309 is the ID of a bread.)
‘3’ is the amount it heals.
‘Bread’ is the description to make it easy.

I hope this helped you and please leave a comment!

Read full topic
item.source: How to make new food BEGINNER FRIENDLY
